Sprinkle inside and out with salt and pepper.
Sprinkle apples with lemon juice.
Heat 1/2 the butter and all the oil in heavy skillet.
Add 1/2 the apples.
Saute 5 minutes, until browned.
Add ginger.
Stuff chicken with apples; tie or skewer chicken cavity closed.
Add remaining butter to pan. Brown chicken slowly on all sides.
Place chicken in heavy casserole with lid.
Add uncooked apples, green onions, thyme, cinnamon (if used), cloves and sugar to skillet.
Saute 2 minutes. Add cider; heat to boiling.
Pour over chicken.
Cook macaroni firm as directed.
Brown turkey and onion together in 4-quart pot.
Drain.
Add stewed tomatoes, oregano, garlic, ketchup and salt.
Simmer 20 minutes.
Add macaroni and simmer 10 minutes more.
Serve with salad.
Mix hamburg, bread crumbs, milk, chopped onion, salt, Worcestershire sauce and egg.
Shape into 20 (1 1/2-inch) balls. Cook meatballs in skillet; remove and drain fat.
Mix brown sugar and cornstarch in skillet.
Stir in pineapple (with syrup), vinegar and soy sauce.
Heat to boiling, stirring.
Reduce heat; add meatballs.
Cover and simmer, stirring occasionally, 10 minutes.
Stir in green pepper and cherries (without syrup). Cover and simmer until crisp-tender, 5 minutes.
Makes 4 servings.
For each serving: Toss 2 cups lettuce and 1/4 cup each peppers, tomatoes, olives, cucumbers and onions in large bowl.
Add 2 Tbsp.
dressing; toss to coat.
Place on serving plate; top with 3 chicken tenders.

ingredients.ingredient: cubed cooked chicken or beef roast

instructions.step: In a large saucepan, bring the broth, tomatoes, onion, cabbage, vegetables and seasonings to a boil. Add macaroni; simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes or until pasta is tender. Add meat; heat through.
Cut steak into thin strips.
In large skillet, brown meat in oil using high heat; add onions.
Saute until tender.
Blend soup, sherry (or water) and liquid from mushrooms.
Add to the meat and onions. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 1 hour or until steak is tender.
Or place in ovenproof casserole or pan and bake at 350° for 45 minutes to 1 hour.
Serve over rice.
Serves 6.
Clean, wash, and dry chicken.
In shallow pan, combine Cheez-It(R) Cracker crumbs with salt, oregano, and celery salt.
Roll pieces of chicken in crumbs until well coated.
Dip chicken in mixture of egg and milk.
Roll again in remaining crumbs until well coated.
In a large fry pan, brown chicken a few pieces at a time, in shortening.
When all pieces are browned, arrange back in fry pan.
Cover and cook over low heat until tender, about 30 minutes.

ingredients.ingredient: kraft extra virgin olive oil tuscan italian dressing

instructions.step: Mix first 4 ingredients in slow cooker.
Add all remaining ingredients except flour and water; toss to coat.
Cover with lid.
Cook on LOW 8 to 9 hours (or on HIGH 4 to 5 hours).
Transfer meat and vegetables to serving bowl with slotted spoon; cover to keep warm.
Mix flour and water until well blended.
Whisk into juices in slow cooker; cover.
Cook on HIGH 15 min.
or until sauce is slightly thickened.
Spoon over meat and vegetables.
Preheat oven to 375F.
Mix dressing and seasonings.
Coat chicken with dressing mixture.
Place in shallow foil-lined baking pan.
Bake 18 to 20 min.
or until chicken is cooked through (170F).

cookingrecipe.name: sausage and bean slow cooker dinner

instructions.step: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook the sausage until well browned, 5 to 7 minutes.
Stir in the onion; cook and stir until lightly browned, 5 to 7 minutes more.
Remove the sausages, and cut them into 1 1/2-inch to 2-inch pieces.
Pour the beef stock, tomatoes, tomato puree, and hot sauce into the skillet with the onion and bring the mixture to a simmer, scraping up any brown bits from the bottom.
Place the carrots into a slow cooker, followed by the garbanzo beans and kidney beans.
Arrange the sausage pieces on top.
Pour the sauce from the skillet into the slow cooker.
Cook on Low for 4 to 6 hours.
Cook ground beef and onions until brown.
Cook rice and drain. Mix these 2 ingredients and add all other ingredients.
Let simmer 10 minutes.
Top with cream cheese.
Cool and serve.
Saute in butter the celery and onion.
Set aside.
Cut, bone and cut into pieces the chicken breasts. Mix with sour cream, mushroom soup, mushrooms, lemon pepper and pepper.
Spread in 13 x 9 x 2-inch casserole dish.
In a large soup pot add the butter and the onions and cook for 3-4 minutes. Then add the flour and cook for another minute.
Slowly add in the chicken broth and the milk while whisking so there are no lumps.
Then add in the remaining ingredients. Cover with a lid and cook on simmer for 10-15 minutes or until the potatoes are fork tender. Then serve.
Cook macaroni but do not rinse.
To this mixture, add tomatoes, butter and spices.
Brown ground beef and onion until onion is clear.
Drain.
Add beef and onion to macaroni mixture.
Simmer for 10 minutes.
Add cheese.
Mix well and pour into baking dish.
Cook at 375° for 30 minutes.
Cook beef in skillet until brown.
Add bell pepper and onion. Cook until tender.
Add chili powder, tomato and corn.
Cook 15 minutes.
Boil noodles as directed; drain.
Add meat mixture.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Place steak in 3-qt casserole.
Cover with onion slices.
Add in bay leaf.
Combine soups, mushrooms, Worcestershire and flour.
Pour over meat.
Cover and bake 2 hrs or possibly till tender.
Remove bay leaf; set oven at 400 degrees.
Place peas on meat.
Mix dumpling ingredients till moist.
Drop by rounded tsp.. Cover.
Bake 20-25 min.
Place chicken in slow cooker; top with artichokes.
Whisk next 6 ingredients until blended; pour over artichokes.
Cover with lid.
Cook on LOW 6 to 8 hours (or on HIGH 3 to 4 hours).
About 1 hour before chicken is ready to serve, cook rice as directed on package, omitting salt.
Add spinach to ingredients in slow cooker just before serving; mix well.
Serve rice topped with chicken mixture and croutons.
In a large bowl, thoroughly mix 1/2 cup of the Prego sauce, beef, bread crumbs, onion and egg.
In 12 x 8-inch baking pan, firmly shape meat into 8 x 4-inch loaf.
Bake at 350° for 1 1/4 hours or until done.

cookingrecipe.name: roasted chicken au jus with cheddar broccoli rice

ingredients.ingredient: lipton recipe secrets onion mushroom soup mix

instructions.step: Preheat oven to 425°. Arrange chicken in broiler pan without the rack; brush with Soup Mix combined with olive oil.
Roast chicken, basting occasionally, 40 minutes or until chicken is thoroughly cooked.
Remove chicken to serving platter. Add hot water to pan and stir, scraping brown bits from bottom of pan. Serve sauce over chicken with hot Knorr(R) Rice SidesTM - Cheddar Broccoli.

cookingrecipe.name: grilled chicken with spicy ginger vinaigrette

instructions.step: Coat a stove-top grill pan or griddle with cooking spray and set over medium-high heat to preheat.
Season both sides of chicken with salt and black pepper.
Place chicken on hot pan and cook 3 to 5 minutes per side, until cooked through.
In a small bowl, whisk together rice wine, vegetable oil, wasabi paste, hot mustard, and ginger.
Set aside.
Heat sesame oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add slaw mix and soy sauce and cook 2 to 3 minutes, until wilted.
Arrange wonton wrappers on a flat surface.
Top each wrapper with 1 heaping teaspoon of slaw mixture.
Pull up sides and pinch the middle together, making a purse.
Heat peanut oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add purses and cook 1 minute, until bottom is golden brown.
Add broth and bring to a simmer.
Cover and steam 3 to 5 minutes, until purses are tender and translucent.
Serve 4 of the chicken breast halves with all of the vinaigrette spooned over top and all of the beggars purses on the side.
Reserve remaining chicken for stroganoff, if desired.
Butter or grease a skillet and place it on a medium-high heat stove.
Toast 2 pieces of bread or English muffin in a toaster. Cook an egg over-medium in the skillet and remember to break the yolk.
When the bread is done, put as much mayonnaise as makes you happy on the bread.
When the egg is done, place a piece of cheese on top, turn off the heat and place it on one piece of the toast. Place the other on top.
If you would rather have the bacon or ham McBrandon, cook some bacon or ham and place that on before you put the top piece of toast on.
Salt & pepper meat and brown lightly in heavy skillet.
Add onions, pepper and mushrooms and brown lightly.
Pour beer over all, stir in catsup and mustard.
Cover tightly and simmer slowly for 2 to 2 1/2 hours or until meat is tender.
Preheat oven to 350°.
In small bowl, combine mustard, lemon juice, garlic, rosemary and pepper.
Coat chicken in mustard mixture.
In sealable bag, combine bran flakes and Parmesan.
Seal bag and crush bran flakes.
Place chicken pieces in a bag a few at a time and shake to coat with crumb mixture.
Brown steak in butter.
Add small amount of water.
Simmer until tender.
Add small amount of water to onion and celery. Cook until nearly tender.
Cook noodles until tender, drain, rinse and drain.
Combine meat, onion, celery, noodles, seasoning, soup and water.
More water may be added, if mixture seems too thick as it bakes.
Pour into greased casserole.
Cover with cheese, bread crumbs and butter.
Bake in a 350° oven for 1 hour.
Remove lid; bake 15 minutes longer.
Serves 8.
This is one of my favourite luncheon meals.
I serve it on a bed of fresh spinach leaves, garnished with orange slices.

The recipe originally called for low/non fat lowfat sour cream, but I found which the lowfat sour cream tends to go runny if its left for several hrs so I tried a combination of half nonfat/half fullfat.
Which seems to work well.
Of course, for those of you not calorie concious, you could use all full fat lowfat sour cream!
:) This does taste better if its refrigerated at least 3-4 hrs before serving but overnight is even better.
In a large bowl combine the chicken, celery, chives, lowfat sour cream and basil; mix lightly with a fork.
Just before serving, add in pepper and salt to taste.
Saute onion, green pepper and celery in butter in a Dutch oven until tender.
Add catsup, water, lemon juice, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, sugar and mustard.
Cook over medium heat for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add frankfurters; simmer an additional 5 minutes, or until franks are thoroughly heated. To serve, place in buns and spoon sauce on top.
Yields 8 servings.
Mix all the ingredients, except the deer and mushrooms, in a large pot.
Add steaks and marinate in refrigerator 6 hours.
If the meat is frozen, do not defrost, just increase the marinating time by at least 2 hours.
Cook the steaks on a grill over hot coals for about 4 minutes on each side or until doneness, basting with marinating sauce several times.
Heat the mushrooms in butter for a steak topping.
Another pizza for you to try out!
I hope you like it.
Cook the beef, break it up nice and good.
Slice the pickles, tomatoes, and onion.
Grate the cheeses.
Wash and chop romaine lettuce.
Put as much Thousand Island dressing on the dough as you would like.
Sprinkle on the beef, then layer the toppings on top of the beef: pickle, tomatoes, onion.
Sprinkle enough jack cheese to cover toppings, but allowing them to still be seen.
Sprinkle on some cheddar to fill in the gaps and only allow some of the toppings to be seen.
Bake at 400 degrees F for 10- 15 minutes or until cheese is nice and bubbly!
Remove from oven and sprinkle lettuce on the top.
Then, enjoy every bite!
Note: The specific order in which you put the toppings on the dough does not alter the taste at all, so feel free to build it any way that you would like.
Pulse peanuts in a food processor until coarsely chopped, then transfer to a bowl.
With motor running, drop garlic and ginger through feed tube and finely chop. Add peanut butter, water, vinegar, soy sauce, sesame oil, sugar, and red-pepper flakes and blend until smooth.
Toss chicken and vegetables with enough dressing to coat, then sprinkle with peanuts and cilantro.
Salt and pepper steak and dredge in flour.
Using a skillet, fry steak in oil only until just light brown on each side.
In same skillet add water, ketchup and worcestershire sauce and let simmer on low heat for 15 to 20 minutes.
Add onion rings and simmer 10 minutes.

Push steak and onions to one side in skillet. Using Pillsbury gravy flour, whisk in vigorously while gravy is bubbling and simmer 5 more minutes. (This flour is the secret to not having lumps in your gravy.).
mix all ingredients together in layers.
place small amounts of mixture in food processer and mix well.
until it is like pate mixture.
when all is mixed form into loaves and bake at 300 for 2 hours.
Grill or cook the bratwurst according to package directions.
Spread horseradish sauce on inside of hoagie roll.
Cut Bratwurst in half lengthwise and place on bun.
Arrange 1-ounce, turkey, 1-ounce ham, 3-slices tomato, 2-slices cheese, 2-strips bacon, 3-slices onion, 1-dill pickle and 1/2-cup lettuce onto bratwurst.

Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion, green pepper, red pepper flakes and dried thyme; cook and stir until the onion is beginning to brown, about 7 minutes. Reduce the heat to low and stir in the tomato paste and season with salt and pepper. Simmer for 3 minutes then stir in the water. Mix in the corned beef and then let it simmer until most of the liquid has evaporated.

cookingrecipe.name: brine to cure ham or bacon

instructions.step: Bring to boil and pour over meat.
Let stand in brine approximately 1 week for bacon and 2 weeks for ham.
